DependenciesThe HelionCE system is dependent on the following major projects:
RabbitMQ for intersystem communication.
NodeJS to run the system.
MySQL for object persistence.
Git or GitHub for authentication and source management.
AngularJS for the single-page web application.
Python for cloud deployments or Docker for local deployments.

ol.li: The Helion Code Engine uses github auth to authenticate users to the system. The app needs to be registered with Github before users can log in.
Open a github.com account or stand up a GitHub Enterprise server on premise.

Register a new Oauth application in Github so that HelionCE can communicate with your version control provider. Public Github: https://github.com/settings/applications/new The secrets that describe your application should be in the automation/ansible/templates/settings.json file for your users to authenticate against Github.
If you're using Github Enterprise, the url will be https://<hostname>/settings/applications/new

Enter values for the following fields.
Field Value Example
Application name The name you'd like users to see when they authenticate with Github Helion Code Engine
Homepage URL The public url to the web role hosting the UX.If this is your first time deploying to this cluster, you might have to run a deployment first and then create the Github OAUTH app. https://<hostname>/
Application description Some text describing the application Helion Code Engine is an integrated CI/CD system.
Authorization callback URL The public url to the application when the user authenticates with github https://<hostname>/auth/github/callback
Once the values are entered and you've hit Register application, you will be presented with a screen that contains your application Client Id and secret.
Navigate to the HP Helion Download Network (HDN) and log in. If necessary, create an account first.
Using your CLI run the following command: openstack, hdpi helionci install --package wscatalog.
